block.p: DEAR DIARY: My wife, Mary, hung a birdhouse on the porch of our house in Matawan with a ''FOR WRENT'' sign. Sure enough a wren couple moved in and had babies, who now keep jabbering all day. I would like to amend the sign to read ''FOR WRENT (cheep).''
BOB McKENTY

DEAR DIARY: My wife, Mary, hung a birdhouse on the porch of our house in Matawan with a ''FOR WRENT'' sign. Sure enough a wren couple moved in and had babies, who now keep jabbering all day. I would like to amend the sign to read ''FOR WRENT (cheep).''
BOB McKENTY

Speaking of birds, a raccoon was raiding our bird feeders -- not just eating but taking them from the tree and dropping them. Our tree lady said other customers had recommended playing a radio all night near the feeders, though she didn't think that was useful.
''Hell's bells,'' she said. ''They just change the station if they don't like the music.''
VERDI JOHNSON

My wife was driving in Hillsdale when a car edged out from a side street and nearly blocked her way. She blew her horn vigorously; the other driver stopped (finally) and blew his in annoyance. As we drove off, my wife tapped the horn lightly and said to me, ''I had the last horn.''
CHARLES KESSELMAN
CRAZY PASS
E-ZPass makes me insane,
I never get in the right lane.
All the signals just confound me,
While other autos zip around me.
Changing lanes just makes me queasy,
E-ZPass is not so easy.
MARILYN COHEN VASSEN
To the Borough of Fort Lee:

''This is to advise you that I received your 'reminder about snow removal' on May 2 along with the advice on the size of the numbers of my home 'visible from the street.' I apologize for the delay in my response. Perhaps the fact that I live on the 18th floor of a high-rise building may be a reason for the delay.''
ROBERT H. BERKLEY
I called an 800 number to get a part for an appliance. The conversation went like this:
He: ''We have the part, but our business is strictly over the counter.''
Me: ''Where are you?''
He: In Somerville (gives the address).
Me: O.K. I'll go there.
At that point I got out a map of New Jersey and found Somerville but could not pin down the street. I called back.
Me: ''We need explicit directions.''
He: ''What road are you coming on?''
Me: ''287 South.''
He: ''I don't know that road. Where are you coming from?''
Me: ''Chatham.''
He: ''Oh, the Cape.''
I knew I would have to go somewhere else for the part.
WARREN. H. WENDELL
I was visiting my mother at the Morris Hills Center nursing facility, who introduced me to an aide.
''This is my daughter,'' Mom said proudly.
''Your daughter?'' the well-meaning aide blurted. ''You look like sisters.''
''Thank you,'' Mom said with a smile.
''Thank you,'' I muttered.
AUDREY CORN
FATHER OF THE BRIDE
With his checkbook at the ready
Stands the father of the bride
With his pen poised firm and steady,
His demeanor filled with pride.
Today will be a fun day
(It's his daughter's taste of heaven).
The checks won't bounce till Monday
When he files Chapter Eleven.
BOB McKENTY
